intro: Parnassia palustris var. neogaea, commonly known as the swamp parnassia, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy white flowers with yellow markings. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in environments with partial to full shade. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are usually unbranched with a hairy texture. It plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil.
